Tekax: 20°12′07″N 89°17′17″W in the southernmost part of the state. Tekax (pronounced [teˈkɑʃ]) means "Place of the Forests" in the Yucatec Maya language. Tekax was briefly declared the capital of Yucatán in 1845. Tekax is also the name of the surrounding municipality of which the city of Tekax serves as municipal seat of government.
In the census of 2005 Tekax had a population of 23
sometimes spelled Tecax (in full: 524. The municipality of Tekax reported a population of 37
located at: 474.76 sq mi) and is the second-largest municipality in geographical area in the state
column6: after Tizimín. The majority of the population in the municipality have Mayan ancestry.
